title: [AnimeRG] Log Horizon S1 (1080p) BluRay Dual Audio HEVC [KoTuWa]
description:
[AnimeRG] Log Horizon - S1 (1080p) BluRay (Dual Audio) HEVC 10bit x265 [KoTuWa] 
=============================================================================== 
 
01-25 Batch. OP,ED. 8.75 GiB. 
 
--  
http://i.imgur.com/jRu34js.png 
-- 

Container         : MKV 
Video             : HEVC x265 10 bit. 1920x1080. ~slower CRF 18 
Audio             : English AC-3, Japanese AAC (LC) TrueVBR â‰¥ Q91 
Subtitles         : English (4 tracks) 
                    Signs + Full 3 SoftSubs (OP,ED kFx HardSub) 
 
 
Use a reputed media player that can play x265 10bits has proper ASS subtitle support. 
Detailed playback help included in 'How_to_Play_ ' file in the torrent. 
MPC-HC, MPC-BE, MPV... are recommended :]  
http://mpc-hc.org   
http://mpcbe.sourceforge.net 
VLC and players like latest GOM, KMP with LAV can play HEVC, but MPC-HC, MPC-BE, MPV... with madVR gives better quality :) 
Linux, Mac, Chrome : libde265 - VLC libde265 plugin or, GStreamer libde265 plugin or ...  
http://libde265.org/downloads-software 
In Mobile, Android, Tabs, use a media player like MX Player, VLC Player... that can play H.265. 
For more info, read the 'How_to_Play_ ' file inside the torrent. 
 
Correctly rendered Styles and Karaoke effects should look like screenshots linked below.

Note 
==== 
Source: [deanzel]'s 1080p package (24.7 GiB), which has, 
SallySubs video and FLAC JAP audio and ENG audio from Chrisazter/MoodKiller DVD. 
HardSubbed OP,ED by SallySubs and Sings n Songs SallySubs+deanzel track and Full SallySubs+deanzel sub track and Full Zurako+deanzel sub track. 
 
Video encoded into 1080p x265 10bit using ~slower preset at crf 18. Sharpened as the BD looks little dull. Separate OP,ED encoded with CRF 16 placebo+ preset, with more detail enhancement. 
English AC-3 track kept intact and the Japanese track encoded into AAC LC TrueVBR â‰¥ Q91 using Apple AAC Encoder (QAAC/CoreAudioToolbox). 
Audio in OP,ED are lossless, FLAC. Separate OP,ED are included just for fun, with higher A/V quality. Each episode has it's own OP,ED... 
Ordered Chapters (OC) with Segment Linking was NOT used :) 
For the previous 720p release, subtitles were slightly modified. Fixed some issues with timing and signs I found randomly. Didn't had resource related time to go through each and every line though! :( 
And for this 1080p release, couple of small changes has been done. 
For ppl who hate LTFinnegan (there are many) AND prefer simple fonts (not many), an extra track added with a different dialogue font :) 
 
Overall, the source video looks better than this. But in most cases, the difference is marginal or like apples/oranges. You compare/decide. 
The source has Micro level details. In this release some micro details are lost due to the nature of HEVC (con), but this has Macro level sharpness (pro :)
